I almost hate to say how much we loved Brian's place, because we know the secret is going to get out and this place will stay booked! This is the absolute best airbnb we have stayed. So clean. spacious, inviting. We didn't want to leave. Brian left a wonderful treat from a local shop, with a handwritten note. It's those small touches that make a huge impact.
The neighborhood is friendly. Great food. Safe for walking. The people were all so kind. We cannot wait to come back. We we're in for Railbird, we want the next trip to just relax at Brian's place more. It's made just for that.
The bed is comfy. The HUGE shower with rainfall feature was my favorite. The sofa was even super comfortable. This is a home and it shows.

Brian and Liz‚Äôs place was absolutely worth the price. We stayed there to celebrate my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday, and they truly went above and beyond. They left a card and a cake from a local bakery in the fridge, which was such a thoughtful touch. These little details are why we highly recommend this location. Additionally, it‚Äôs within walking distance of restaurants, shops, and retail stores.

Great palace and wonderful host. Best AirBnb we have stayed at and this was our 9th stay. Close to a bunch of restaurants, museums and live music. We walked to almost everything and when we went to Buffalo Trace but we got a free Trolley ride with a very knowledgeable driver Mike. I would highly recommend.
Very cool place with great food in area

We loved Brian‚Äôs place. It‚Äôs very modern, spacious, and luxurious. The perfect balance of technology and taste. It felt more like having your own theatre than just a living room. It‚Äôs the type of hidden gem that we‚Äôre always searching for on Airbnb. Location is walkable to downtown and drivable to many of the best distilleries on the bourbon trail. Brian was a great host / communicator throughout our entire stay. Would love to return. Thanks for having us.

Brians place is stunning, truly a living picture right out of Architectural Digest and HGTV. High end renovation, state of the art amenities, beautiful furnishings and decor.
The shower is stunning, 3 shower heads in a large walk in shower for two, heated tiles, a large office space with desk and printer.
Brian was very responsive and helpful. I travel a lot for my consulting practice and this is by far the most beautiful, large and functional space i have stayed in . Big plus for me no stairs and centrally located.

My only complaint is that i went to book my next trip and the place is booked until July. I cant wait to get back to Brians place.

We had such an amazing time at Brian‚Äôs home; it was beautiful, clean, well stocked, and nicely located downtown, which made it super easy to access all the restaurants and shops. Highly recommend Serafini for a nice dinner and Goodwood (which is literally a few doors down) for a delicious lunch and beer.
The place was very clean and tidy, the bed was very comfortable, and the living room was the perfect set up to enjoy a night in and watch movies/the football game on the big screen. We had so much fun.
Brian was a responsive and friendly host who made sure we had everything we needed. We will surely stay here again when in Frankfort!

Had a great stay at Brian's place! Walkable to restaurants and shopping. The space is beautiful, very high-end and cozy! So many little touches that add to the experience, this will definitely be my go-to place in Frankfort, can't wait to come back!
Beautiful home . More then enough supplies. Very comfortable beds. Very fast return of messages. Hope this place is available again
Exceeded our expectations in every way possible. Our stay couldn‚Äôt have been better. No detail overlooked.

Great place to stay. All the conveniences of home and more. Clean and the bed was very comfortable.
Definitely recommend and will come back again.
Carlos was a great host. the house was absolutely beautiful inside and out. would definitely stay here again. i loved it!

The River Road bungalow was pristine. The home was very inviting and incredibly well kept. Rear porch area and backyard was really nice to sit at night.
Carlos is a great host‚Ä¶ I would recommend this for anybody visiting the Bourbon Trail anybody going to Keeneland racecourse or anybody visiting the Louisville to Lexington area

This tiny cabin was the cutest!!! It was super clean and for a one-night stay as we passed through Kentucky, it was perfect! I loved it so much I'm asking my husband about building one on our farm. Matt was super responsive to messages and even gave us a great breakfast spot recommendation. Would definitely stay again!! Loved it!!!

I would go back in a heartbeat, this cabin was FANTASTIC! It was comfortable, clean, a beautiful property, the craftsmanship on the place is just gorgeous. We had a fantastic one night stay, we wish it was longer and hope to one day be back!! I recommend this cabin to any adventurers
Beautiful place, great craftsmanship in the house! Great Tiny Home!
It was a fun spot, great location if you‚Äôre touring the Bourbon Trail. Quiet, & peaceful.

Matt & The Tiny House are worth it‚Äôs weight in gold! Matt is the neighbor everyone wants! We met in the yard, we talked without awkwardness. He checked on us in the evening to make sure everything was okay.

We definitely recommend Matt‚Äôs home when visiting the area.
Just what we needed for our short stay to visit Buffalo Trace!

What a treasure! Everything was so perfect. The location is so easy to get to but yet feels so private and intimate. The area is just beautiful. Every detail was thought of when crafting this tiny house. You can see and feel the love that went into the creation of this house and in all the intimate touches that Matt and Lilly leave for the guests. They think of everything. Our only regret is that we didn't get to stay longer.

This place was beautiful! If you love beautiful wood craftsmanship‚Ä¶ this is your huckleberry! Matt thought of EVERYTHING! For a ‚Äú tiny‚Äù cabin‚Ä¶ he had everything you could possibly need. All was great üòä

This place was beautifully crafted. Exactly how it looked in pictures and perfect for an overnight stay. Matt was very communicative and made sure we had everything we needed. Loved the swing out front!
We had a brief but great stay! It was easy to get in and it was very comfortable!

The tiny house was beautiful, just steps to the creek. Matt was responsive to questions, friendly and provided local recommendations. We took a short walk and enjoyed the area. If we are ever in the area again, we would definitely stay here!
This tiny house‚Äôs heart and soul are anything but tiny!! So much attention to detail in this handcrafted gem of a place that is just perfect for a getaway!
Awesome little place! Matt is a great guy, hung out one afternoon and did a little fishing together! Doesn‚Äôt get much better for hospitality!

We absolutely loved this tiny cabin! it was perfect for the 2 of us, and can't wait to stay again. would highly recommend looking into if you're traveling to Frankfort, in a great place for some bourbon chasing!

Matt's tiny home was very inviting, private, and clean. We loved the layout of the space, and the custom woodwork throughout the home. Also the location was near restaurants, and close to downtown Frankfort.
Great location and such a cozy place to stay! The house is beautifully built, private, yet close to attractions and restaurants. Would absolutely stay here again!
This small home is perfect for a couple looking to get away! Everything needed was there in a condensed space. Very relaxing environment!

Perfect place for a couple to stay right outside of Frankfort. We enjoyed 2 nights at Matt's place and the only thing missing was meeting Matt and sharing a bourbon. Easy to find and super close to Buffalo Trace distillery which was our main goal. We also drove to many other distilleries in the area. Matt's cabin was spotless and comfortable for 2, but can't say enough about the aesthetic and fun of staying in the cabin. Would definitely come back and stay here and highly recommend for 1-2 people looking for a great place to stay.
This tiny Cabin is really cute , have to see quite a gem and so peaceful and cozy , Definitely will be back

He was willing to help with anything you needed and communicated with you during your stay on the app, but he let's you have your privacy and doesn't intrude. It looks exactly what you think it would with the pictures and is a great central location between Frankfort, Lexington, and Louisville. Really good value...
Great little cabin! Enjoyed the stay and would visit again.
The tiny home is in a very peaceful setting. It was clean, quiet and cozy.
We stayed four nights for the Thanksgiving Holiday. The house was great, and Matt was very responsive and friendly. Would recommend and definitely will book again.

Very cute and comfortable place for our stay; close to friends at the campground across the street. Great outdoor space!
Everything we needed! Matt checked in with us several times to make sure we didn't need anything.

Wow
This place was so unique.
When we first drove up to it, I was like, "What did we get here". BUT stay with me, the outside is so cool with the little front porch, it even has a porch swing. A great stone firepit and bench in the front yard and out back a table and grill. Once you are inside, you will find so many cool things. The kitchen had everything you could ever need. Matt has thought of everything and many extras. The work he did in this place was great.
We only stay in Arbnb, no hotels for us, and this one is nice.

Matt‚Äôs place was well priced and provided exactly what I needed for a quick overnight stay on my way back home. Would definitely recommend this to an individual or couple looking for an inexpensive, cool place to stay for a couple of nights. Looking forward to staying here again in the future and checking out the bourbon trail

The cabin is so cute, clean, and comfortable. The detail he put into the place is really incredible. We were looking for a place for the night on our bourbon trail trip and really enjoyed the night we spent. Would totally go back there again on another trail trip!
Great place and perfect spot for bourbon trail hopping! Would absolutely return!

Matt is the perfect host. we love this place and do not want to stay anywhere else when we need a getaway. The house is adorable, and nice and quiet, which is what we needed living in the city.
We will see you again very soon!

Situated right on the Elkhorn Creek, Matt's place was just perfect for us, travelling from the UK we'd always wanted to stay in a cabin like this and it certainly lived up to the billing. Although small everything inside has been thought about and built to maximise the available space in a modern way. Sitting on the swing seat on the front porch reading a book was a little joy. We met Matt, he's a great guy and available to help with anything. Highly recommended for the slightly more adventurous type.

Matt was a great host. Very friendly and loved meeting Aspen. The house was everything that we expected and more. Very close to a lot of Bourbon Distilleries. And great local restaurants. House was as clean as a whistle. Looking forward to staying here again. Nothing but good memories were made here. Only negative was the internet was a bit spotty, that was the least of this property. Loved the custom work Matt put into this tiny house. Words don‚Äôt do this place justice. If you‚Äôre considering staying here do it! Couldn‚Äôt have picked a better place to stay.

This is such a precious little house! It‚Äôs peaceful, private and cozy. There are lots of special touches everywhere in the little cabin and on the spacious property around it. It‚Äôs super tiny but it‚Äôs full of magic.
Matt is a great host, caring and thoughtful. We felt welcome and right at home as soon as we arrived. This little gem gets five stars from me!
Unbelievable craftsmanship, clean, the bed was crazy comfortable, and the kitchen was perfect. I will stay here again, safe location not far from Buffalo Trace.
Awesome tiny house and a very quiet and peaceful street! Very close to tons of distilleries in the area and was great spot to rest up after a day on the bourbon trail.

This tiny home was perfect for our weekend exploring the Bourbon Trail! Comfy bed & just enough room to come back and relax. We even had a bonfire & drank some bourbon with Matt to finish up the day one night.
Awesome stay. Will definitely be back!
Very beautifully crafted. Very clean and cozy. Lots of wildlife, pets, and beautiful plants. A wonderful place to sit on the porch and listen to the crickets.
The cabin is beautiful! We loved the area- distilleries, restaurants, and enjoyed the live Bluegrass music from the campground Saturday night. Matt was very helpful and responsive.
Amazing little cabin in a great little quiet spot! Loved it!

This house is so cute and cozy, and the craftsmanship is beautiful. Even though I was a last-minute guest, Matt was so accommodating and everything was spotless. Loved the porch to watch the morning rain.

My husband and I loved Matt's place. Matt was a great host. He answered all of our questions and checked on us to make sure there was nothing needed. He sacrificed his own personal time to ensure that everything was taken care of for us! The home was very clean. We will stay again when we return to Kentucky.
Matt's place is quirky. we loved it. we stayed one night it had everything we needed and expected. we had never stayed in a tiny house before the craftsmanship makes this one worthwhile.
beautiful tiny home, I will definitely visit again.
Loved this little cabin! Would definitely book again!!

The tiny house was perfect for a night away from my campervan and put me close to Coolmore at Ashmont Stud where I had a scheduled tour the following afternoon.
Matt is a great host as well.
This was my first time staying in an Airbnb. This was an expensive treat for myself. Hope I was a good guest in kind- all my future Airbnb stays are this nice with friendly hosts.
Cute little place to stay! Super cozy!
Just needed a place to sleep a few nights. Safe. Quiet. It is fine for 1-2 people‚Ä¶ Any more than that I would consider it to be crowded.
This place is SO cute! Matt was super nice and helpful! Will definitely stay here again!

Our choice for the week couldn‚Äôt have been better! Peaceful and tranquil surroundings coupled with this unique cabin made for a perfect week. This cabin offered us a great location to enjoy much of the bourbon trail, scenic drives and wonderful food found in this area of Kentucky.
Love this little slice of heaven..such a cute cabin with an excellent host. This is my second time staying and I will definitely be back again!

Great location for trips on the Bourbon trail or to learn about KYs history in Frankfort. This is truly a tiny house/cabin. The bathroom is so cute, and quite small on the upstairs level next to the bedroom. It has everything you need. The kitchen was completely outfitted and there were snack + breakfast options. The front porch is fantastic - great for morning coffee or evening drink. You can also take a short walk to see the Elkhorn River. Tami‚Äôs Diner is a quick trip up the road for breakfast or lunch on the cheap.
Awesome place no complaints here!

Matt is a great host who lives next door. He even let me borrow his golf cart for a quick visit to the RV park next door. The tiny home is exquisite and, even though it looks like it's been there for 100 years, it's up to date and modern inside. Only know that the bathroom is upstairs. We had a great experience.

Matt is a fabulous host and this little cabin is a gem! He made us feel right at home and even stocked us up with firewood. The surroundings are beautiful and within a short walk of Elkhorn Creek. The outdoor space is wonderful. We grilled out and sat around the outdoor fireplace every night. The craftsmanship of the cabin is amazing; from the live edge wood spiral staircase to the copper shower and kitchen sink. It was so convenient too. It is located about 10 minutes drive from I64 exit 58. We went canoeing during our stay and were only 15 minutes away. We would love to go back!
It was a good place to unwind. We like Elkhorn Creek, it was very convenient! Matt was very reachable if we had any questions or needs.
This was the most wonderful, comfortable, unique place I have stayed and I will be coming back again. Matt was a wonderful host checking in to see if I needed anything. Just amazing.

Matt and Lily made us feel right at home in the tiny house. The tiny house is perfect in size, shape, and accommodation. We have stayed at the tiny house for an event in Georgetown Kentucky several years in a row and plan to come back Memorial weekend in 2024 to ride in the Horsey Hundred. A Trifecta all its own: Bourbon, bikes, and horses. I can't think of a better way to spend the Memorial weekend: AWESOME HOST, excellent accommodations, and beautiful and majestic surroundings (did I mention mountains and horses?) all wrapped up in one location. PARADISE!!
Matt was the best host we have met so far. He went above and beyond. We will be staying here again go to go play the courses in the area! Definitely will recommend to others!

Matt was an amazing host! This charming tiny cabin was exactly what my husband and I needed while travelling the bourbon trail! We luckily got to meet Matt in the evening and had a hood chat. His sweet dog, Aspen, was the most welcoming and friendly pup, he was a highlight for sure!
I would recommend this air b&b to anyone looking for a quick get away, or a serene spot to recharge. Thanks again!
Awesome little place. Matt was very responsive. Very clean and in a super pretty area. We loved it!
Beautiful tiny home in a beautiful location! I will definitely be keeping this place in mind when I return to the area!

We love Matt‚Äôs place. It was our 2nd stay there. It‚Äôs unique and so well made. Cute and cozy. Great place to stay for adventurous people who are in the area for the Bourbon trail. We had a good dinner and music at Goodwood downtown. We also like Melissa‚Äôs family diner for breakfast.

This was my first stay as a part of a solo trip.
Just what I needed to get centered, and get in the right mind as I got away from my day to day.
It was peaceful, little cabin, perfect for just one person. Matt was responsive. His golden retriever was very friendly.
This was my first experience using Airbnb, and I loved it.

Matt's place made the Kentucky bourbon trail trip so much more memorable! Matt's and his golden were beyond helpful and friendly. I don't write reviews but felt the need to support such a great guy and great stay. He built that place with love. Stay here, you won't regret it!

We came across this property searching for a place to stay in Frankfort. This was our first Airbnb stay and Matt made it a memorable one! Check in was slick, the space is exactly as described. Beautiful area and cute cabin! It was a great trip.
What a cute and beautiful place. Will definitely stay here again and recommend to family and friends!
Loved our stay..the cabin was excellent. Would definitely stay again..the night was perfect!
We truly enjoyed our time at Matt's tiny house. He was extremely friendly and obviously very talented. We will be back again. We enjoyed our visits from his very friendly pets. üòä

The cabin is well built and the craftsmanship is very impressive!

Not only was the Tiny Cabin well maintained and very quaint, but so relaxing! We didn't need much but if we did Matt was ready to assist in any way he could.
Stayed 1 night but I wish it could have been a week as we would have loved to utilized the amenities on the river which was 20 steps away.
Warning, WONDERFUL Aspen, the golden retrieve is a pro level begger! That boy has refined his game and we loved it!
Great place and host

Matt and Lily have created such a thoughtful and intentional little cabin. We marveled at the construction and design of the space, and the copper touches really created a unique environment. Matts got a great little place that has everything you could want in a tiny house and it‚Äôs beautifully built and crafted.
This was a great place to stay. Very peaceful. Matt was a great host, always ensuring that we had everything we needed.

Overall 10/10, my wife and I are already planning a trip for the spring to come back.
Great place to stay!!
Enjoyed the stay! Lovely place and great atmosphere! Thank you!

I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the tiny house! The spot was cozy and the small kitchen had everything you need to cook tucked neatly away. Getting to meet the cat and one of the dogs was a highlight! Matt was super helpful and made sure I had everything I needed. Would stay again!

Perfection! Exactly as listed and more. Experienced host, and it shows. Every detail was considered. So comfy, clean and convenient to everything. Matt was beyond sweet and ahead of each detail. Would def book again and 100% recommend!

This Tiny house seriously exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend this spot to anyone. If we are ever back in the area we will be sure to book with Matt again. The house is charming down to every little detail. Matt was super friendly and gave us great recommendations. 10/10

The cabin is as beautiful as pictured. Matt is very responsive. It was a very cold weekend and Matt made sure to check on us to ensure we had everything we needed to stay cozy and warm during our stay. It was a lovely, peaceful, relaxing stay, just what we were looking for. I highly recommend!

Matt & Lily's tiny house is definitely worth a detour. We greatly enjoyed the short stay. Also the tip with the fire from previous guests was one of our highlights. The other was clearly the visits from the animals Aspen and Pepper. Thank you Matt for the hospitality! Highly recommend!

We had a great time staying at this place and conversing with Matt! We also appreciated Aspen for checking up on us.
The place provides an area away from everything where you feel one with nature.

The house is about 10 min away from Buffalo Trace, as well. Matt and his daughter, Lily, are so friendly and accommodating. Aspen, the golden retriever was also awesome! Pepper, the kitty, is super cute and playful! You will not be disappointed!!!
Matt & Lily truly go the extra mile. From fresh cut flowers, to the added local touches- this is a hidden paradise!
Perfect little spot to stay! Matt was an amazing Host, especially for our last minute reservation!! Definitely recommend staying here!
Fantastic. Beautifully appointed. A delight for the eyes with its gorgeous stairs and floors, copper sink and shower, adorable tin pail sink. You will love your stay with Matt. So fun!
This place is amazing! Interior is a designers dream. Do not hesitate to book this tiny cabin. It‚Äôs worth every penny!

We stayed at the Tiny House for 3 nights and it was wonderful. Make no mistake it is a tiny house, bathroom and stairs are small but totally livable. The wood details of the house are beautiful. We had a fire outside at night, enjoyed the outdoors and got a visit from Matt's dog Aspen and his kitty cats.
It is perfectly placed to visit one or all of the surrounding bourdon distilleries or the
history and parks of the surrounding area. It is in a neighborhood that we walked in, felt safe and people were friendly.

Great getaway! Superb Tiny House experience. Truly a Super Host!
Our favorite place to stay in Kentucky!!!
Great visit

This tiny house is a work of art‚Ä¶you will not be disappointed. I‚Äôve stayed with Matt several times and he and Lily (and Aspen) are wonderful hosts!!!
Try Goodwood in downtown Frankfort for yummy food!!
My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night and it was awesome! Such a cute little space but felt so roomy. Everything was perfect and we loved hanging out with the animals outside!
The home is amazing we highly recommend staying there.

We absolutely loved our stay in Matt's tiny home! The home is gorgeous and in a great location. We loved all of the thoughtful touches too. Matt was wonderful and checked in with us several times during our stay. Definitely would recommend if you're looking for a nice getaway stay. Thank you Matt for hosting us!

Awesome tiny house with natural wood throughout and a lovely little spot just steps from a wide creek. Matt is communicative, very friendly and super helpful. We had a fantastic stay and would love to again next time we come through.

Excellent place to stay it was a beautiful little place to stay for a few days. This was our first time staying in a tiny house and it was different, in a good way. We loved our stay well worth the money. Thanks Matt for a great place to stay on our vacation to Kentucky.

Cute rustic tiny cabin with extra special touches other places don‚Äôt think of or do. I loved sitting on the porch swing and listening to the birds in the morning. We enjoyed a walk to the creek as well. Matt is a great host!

Super treat to stay in this cozy, clean, creatively designed, fun, one of a kind home. We loved staying here and having access to a beautiful nearby river and town of Frankfort. The host is super hospitable. Can't go wrong here.. highly recommend!
We had a wonderful time at this tiny home!! 5/5 would recommend staying here ! Very cute !
Cute place. Teeny tiny bathroom was a bit of a challenge.
Wonderful way to sit back and relax. The tiny home was a perfect way to end our stay in Kentucky.

Very relaxing and charming tiny house close to the bourbon trail tastings and tours. Love all the details and the porch swing. Grateful for the AC on such a hot day. Would definitely visit again. Thanks!
Adorable tiny house at a great price!

Very adorable, artful, comfortable, and well-appointed tiny cabin. Low-key, relaxed, and safe setting. The outdoor spaces are thoughtfully designed; I spent lots of time on the porch and the patio taking in the greenery and the birds. Gentle Elkhorn creek is right there and very beautiful. Matt is good people üòÑ. Thanks for a fantastic stay!

This tiny house is the best ever tiny house we stayed in. Matt is very kind and was very helpful with our late check in. There are so many thoughtful touches to the space. We only stayed for one night but we wish we had stayed longer. The surroundings are peaceful.
This place was absolutely beautiful and had wonderful craftsmanship and charm. I met Matt and his daughter who were the nicest and most accommodating people. Would def recommend!
Simple, clean, value, easy to access. Matt+Lily ROCK!!!

Great place to stop for a night. Was clean and comfortable, and had more than I expected for a tiny house. Met my needs for a place to sleep for a night, but if you‚Äôre planning on spending more time note that there wasn‚Äôt really wifi inside the house.
This was my 3rd time staying at Matt's cabin. The cabin and hospitality is consistently great. Highly recommended if you're in the Frankfort area.

Matt's cabin is truly a perfect place to tour the bourbon trail. Perfect location, clean, beautifully built, and lots of fun and unique touches. We loved the fire pit and porch sitting during our stay. I highly recommend this location and would love to visit again!

Stayed 11 days at Matt's tiny house, which is so much more than that. Creative, thoughtful and interesting, comfortable, well sized and great use of space, it is, as everyone else says, a hand-crafted marvel. You will love your time here. The Elkhorn Creek is a Kentucky treasure and a stones throw away. The setting is quiet and comfortable and the private tiny house is nestled in plenty of green space. Matt is super responsive and available, a truly nice guy and lives close by with his daughter and sweet dog. Easy access to the remarkably overlooked small city of Frankfort, a quick 25 minutes to Lexington and 45 to Louisville, the location is great. Don't miss the Buffalo Trace and Castle and Key distilleries just up the road. Not on the traditional Bourbon trail, they are still at the top of the list to visit. Heirloom restaurant, in the historic town of Midway, 15 minutes away, is an exceptional restaurant. You're going to love Matt's place and your experience in Frankfort.
It's amazing!!

Beautiful little house in nice area. There is a swing on the front porch to sit on, and a private back yard with a table and chairs. There is a little bird house by the front door and the finch that lives there sang to my delight. Matt built the house himself and the craftmanship and design is spectacular.
Tiny cabin is great. We loved the porch swing.

The tiny cabin was a marvel to view. Really cool place that my wife and I enjoyed staying in. I‚Äôm a larger man and I have to admit, I had trouble negotiating the stairs and shower, but I managed. My wife is smaller and she kept making fun of me!

We had a great time staying in this tiny house! Our trip was centered around the Ark Encounter in Williamstown, KY. However, when our 12-year-old daughter saw this listed and was really excited to stay in it we knew that this would add to our trip.
